Description: Carved and painted wooden shabti with a black lappet-wig, a red modelled face with black eyes, a red collar and parallel painted red hands holding two red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(very worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and bandaging.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
